 I wouldn't just stop liking a band like U2 or an artist like Ray Charles because they won Grammys, that would be ridiculous, but the fact is, I simply don't care for most of the musicians that win Grammys or their style of music.
 
 The Grammys are driven almost entirely by $$$$. Record sales, not quality, is the determining factor in most cases. Record sales for the most part, are driven by industry and the record companies. It's a VERY rare artist that can generate big album sales without massive industry backing. If you've got another explanation for Ashley Simpson selling a million records, I'd love to hear it. :p 
 
 My other major peeve - Ray Charles has been completely ignored by the Grammys for most of his life, until he passed away, then all of a sudden a huge tribute to a musical genious. Country music did the same thing with Johnny Cash. He couldn't even get his songs played on the radio, after he died, everyone was tripping over themselves to heap awards on him and flash his name on the screen. Just rubs me the wrong way. 
 
 Besides, there's no more vicious a kiss of death to a career than winning the "Best New Artist" award at the Grammys. :p
